qas.question: A forced trade agreement between two countries would be an example of what?
colonial rule, or physical occupation of a territory is an example of what kind of imperialism?
Some have generalized the meaning of the word imperialism down to general-purpose what?
Which is more costly, formal, or informal imperialism?

answers.text: Informal rule is generally less costly

qas.question: What subtle tool can be used in an informal imperialistic situation to expand a controlled area?
A forced trade agreement between two countries is not an example of what?
colonial rule, or physical occupation of a territory is not an example of what kind of imperialism?
Nobody has generalized the meaning of the word imperialism down to general-purpose what?
Which is less costly, formal, or informal imperialism?
What subtle tool can not be used in an informal imperialistic situation to expand a controlled area?

context: The definition of <a0_3>imperialism<a0_3/> has not been finalized for centuries and was confusedly seen to represent the policies of major powers, or simply, general-purpose <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><a2_4><b7_0>aggressiveness<b7_0/><a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>. Further on, some writers[who?] used the term imperialism, in slightly more discriminating fashion, to mean all kinds of domination or control by a group of people over another. To clear out this confusion about the definition of imperialism one could speak of <a1_0>"<a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><a1_4><a3_3><a3_4><b6_0>formal<b6_0/><a3_4/><a3_3/><a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/>"<a1_0/> and <a0_0>"<a0_2><b5_0><b8_0>informal<b8_0/>" imperialism<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_0/>, the first meaning physical control or "full-fledged colonial rule" while the second implied less direct rule though still containing perceivable kinds of dominance. <a0_1><a3_1><a3_2>Informal rule<a3_2/><a0_1/> is generally less costly<a3_1/> than taking over territories formally. This is because, with <a3_0>informal<a3_0/> rule, the control is spread more subtly through <a4_1><a4_2><a4_4>technological superiority<a4_2/><a4_1/>,<a4_4/> enforcing land officials into large debts that cannot be repaid, <a4_0><a4_3><b9_0>ownership of private industries<b9_0/><a4_3/><a4_0/> thus expanding the controlled area, or having countries agree to uneven trade agreements forcefully.
